you still haven't mentioned what you think the problem is...
1st.  Can you get any other program to play sound?
what errors does Quake 3 give when you load it up?  Does it mention sound.
befor that can you do a quick  sudo ps aux | grep [e] sd  and check that the problem is ESD holding the sound device open
esd is a program that shares the 1 sound card between the many programs that want to use the sound card at once
most GNOME applications know how to talk to esd directly
this is an onboard nvmax card
Quake3 doesn't.  Either you need to give it full control of the sound card by stopping esd (killall esd), or you need to teach Quake3 to use ESD by running it with  esddsp
esddsp  can be found in  esound-clients  which you can install with 'sudo apt-get install esound-clients'
